pic.title: 3D Modeling: My First modeling project using Sub-Divs. The task was to model an object we found in the physics world.
3D Modeling: The purpose of this project was to create a building structure using NURBS modeling.
3D Modeling: Improving upon the last project to improve the structure and apply textures to the scene using NURBS modeling.
3D Modeling: Poly modeling a character to learn character modeling, I chose to model an IRobot character with a little twist.
3D Modeling: Same Poly character from the side, naturally my skills has improved since I last modeled this.
3D Modeling: Modeling a car using any means necessary, I chose to NURB model the car. If I had to choose again I would probably Poly Model it.

folder.name: Multimedia
folder.video: Animation I: Learning how to animate, taking in the basics and perfecting the craft.
Animation I: Improving animation skills by using more advanced models.
Animation I: A long conveyer belt animation to teach us how to animate, texture and render our animations.
Animation I: Learning dynamic animation in Maya, the entire projects uses dynamics with no keyframe animation.

Animation II: A group project which consisted of designing, modeling, animating and rendering an original world populated with originals beings, objects and/or substances doing originals things in original ways. My contribution was doing the bug models and all of the particle effects.

Animation II: I had to design and model an original Robot “character,” and create a custom Control Rig with which the Robot will be animated. The task was to formulate a short animated story for the Robot and the productions must feature a deliberate and appropriate color scheme and aesthetic design.

pic.title: Artificial Intelligence: The first project in Artificial Intelligence was a problem dealing with Breath-first and Depth-first search. The purpose of this program was to perform the two searches on the Ghostbusters (indicated by the blue ghost) was to search though the maze using the two searches to find the Ghost.

Artificial Intelligence: In this programming we were to implement the A* search technique to solve the 8 puzzle problem. We were to also devise and employ various heuristics to learn more about informed search strategies.

Artificial Intelligence: Implement the path-finding algorithm through a color-coded map using the A* algorithm. We were to follow specific guidelins to solve this problem with the desired effect. Guidelines (1) The algorithm must enter the map through the upper left-hand corner (2) The exit point is the lower right-hand corner (3) The algorithm should paint black the shortest path from the start to the final state (4) Map color codes: blue = water, yellow = desert, white = mountain, red = hill, green = forest. (5) Evaluate each state using the usual F = G + H (6) Use Manhattan distance for the heuristic function H() (7) Implement G() using the observation that the path finder prefers visiting states in the following order: forest: first choice, desert: second choice, hill: third choice, mountain: fourth choice, shallow ocean: fifth choice, deep ocean*: avoided at all costs. (*) a cell is considered a deep ocean cell if it is surrounded by at least 3 ocean cells in all directions (8) Allow diagonal moves

OpenGL Graphics: It was a basic program created in OpenGL where you had to draw a green triangle on top of a blue square on top of a red triangle. And the task was to perform basic tasks using the mouse to change the color of the objects on the screen and translate the objects by using the arrow keys.

OpenGL Graphics: This assignment dealt with creating a 200 by 200 world where there are 2 alien ships initially facing opposite directions and the scenario is that one ship is moving backwards inside the world. By clicking of the left mouse button, your view will change from one ship to another and by checking on the 's' or 'd' and the 'k' or 'l' keys you can translate or rotate the alien ship depending on your view.
OpenGL Graphics: Essentially similar to the previous however this time instead of a wire world the world is using solid objects, Fog and shadows.

OpenGL Graphics: This assignment dealt with drawing a bunny using vectors and triangle's. The strategy was to essentially draw a bunny using triangles, placing them in specific locations in order for the bunny to look specifically like a bunny. Later the task was to translate, rotate, and scale the bunny through right clicking the mouse button to obtain the dropdown menu.

Computer Vision: In this assignment you are to determine weather or not this given image is a binary image to a gray-scale image. After creating a menu item you are to, along with checking the type of image, check if the images borders are 0, check if the image is 4 connected, and count the number of objects in the image, this can only work on a binary image.

Computer Vision: Using the connected components labeling techniques, the task was to extend the program to track binary objects. Allow the user to specify the object by allowing them to click on a point within the object. The program should then track the 4-connected object including that point. Your program should also do the following: 1.) Add a menu item that allows the user to toggle between tracking 4- and 8-connected objects. 2.) Report region properties: area, centroid, and bounding box. 3.) Change the appearance of the tracked region (in the window), change the appearance of the centroid, and draw the bounding box.

folder.name: Games
folder.video: engine:DIVINE: A game prototype created at Drexel University it is a fast-paced, epic third-person shooter focusing on large-scale "boss" encounters, featuring several phases and play styles for each enemy the main character faces. This prototype was featured at Eurographics '08 in Greece. My task in this game was as a Lead Programmer, I built the AI for this game, the particle effect and programmed the audio within the game.

Maxwells Demon: A 3D puzzle based game which utilizes NeuroSky BCI technology to allow users to actually move objects within the game with their minds. This game is still in BETA due to Blade 3D being a brand new engine and fact that BCI interface with gaming is something that has never been attempted thus far. I was the lone programmer in this project and had the task of integrating the NeuroSky device with the Blade3D Game Engine, the coding was mostly done in C# and integration with the Blade 3D game engine required Blade 3D specific syntax. I also created a random distraction generator with would cycle through 1 random distraction out of 5 per level and trigger when the attention level of the player was raised to a certain point. For research purposes I was also give the task of programmatically generating an XML file which would hold specific player data during a specific time in order to document when a player was, what is attention level was, and which distract had occurred to trigger a distortion in the players Attention. This was done so that it could be charted in flash for ease of use.
